articles.author: ZEKE MILLER, JILL COLVIN and JOSH BOAK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump on Wednesday agreed to hold two campaign debates — the first on June 27 hosted by CNN and the second on Sept.
articles.title: Biden and Trump, trading barbs, agree to 2 presidential debates, in June and September

articles.author: BELA SZANDELSZKY and KAREL JANICEK
articles.description: BANSKA BYSTRICA, Slovakia (AP) — Slovakia’s populist Prime Minister Robert Fico was shot multiple times and gravely wounded Wednesday, but his deputy prime minister said he believed Fico would survive.
articles.title: Slovakia's populist prime minister shot in assassination attempt, shocking Europe before elections

articles.author: EMILY WANG FUJIYAMA and CHRIS BODEEN
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — Russia’s President Vladimir Putin landed Thursday in Beijing for a two-day state visit to China, in a show of unity between the authoritarian allies as Moscow presses forward with a new offensive in Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia's Putin arrives in China for state visit in a show of unity between the authoritarian allies

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN and KEVIN McGILL
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court on Wednesday ordered Louisiana to hold congressional elections in 2024 using a House map with a second mostly Black district, despite a lower-court ruling that called the map an illegal racial gerrymander.
articles.title: Supreme Court orders Louisiana to use congressional map with additional Black district in 2024 vote

articles.author: COLLEEN LONG
articles.description: A gag order. The House Speaker turning up outside court. Angry denouncements of the judge overseeing the case.
articles.title: The jurors in Trump's hush money trial are getting a front row seat to history -- most of the time

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG, WAFAA SHURAFA and ABBY SEWELL
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday fended off criticism that he is not planning for a postwar reality in the Gaza Strip, saying it was impossible to prepare for any scenario in the embattled Palestinian enclave until Hamas is defeated.
articles.title: Netanyahu fends off criticism at home and abroad over his lack of a postwar plan for Gaza

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The number of reported sexual assaults across the military decreased last year, and a confidential survey found a 19% drop in the number of service members who said they had experienced some type of unwanted sexual contact, according to new figures obtained by The Associated Press.
articles.title: Reported sex assaults in the US military have dropped. That reverses what had been a growing problem

articles.author: MIKE SCHNEIDER and TERRY SPENCER
articles.description: OCALA, Fla. (AP) — A man with a long record of dangerous driving told investigators he smoked marijuana oil and took prescription drugs hours before he sideswiped a bus, killing eight Mexican farmworkers and injuring dozens more, according to an arrest report unsealed Wednesday.
articles.title: Driver said he smoked pot oil, took medication before Florida crash that killed 8 Mexican workers

articles.author: MIKE STOBBE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The number of U.S. fatal overdoses fell last year, according to Centers for Disease Control and Prevention data posted Wednesday.
articles.title: Fewer US overdose deaths were reported last year, but experts are still cautious

articles.author: WAYNE PARRY
articles.description: OCEAN GROVE, N.J. (AP) — In this seaside community that calls itself “God's Square Mile at the Jersey Shore,” all the land is owned by a religious group that has for generations enforced an 11th Commandment: Thou shalt stay off the beach on Sunday morning.
articles.title: This, too, could pass: Christian group's rule keeping beaches closed on Sunday mornings may end
